title: Object spinning in circle at constant speed

content.question: In the figure shown, a small object of mass <math alttext="m" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is spinning in a nearly horizontal circle of radius <math alttext="r" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>r</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> at a constant speed <math alttext="v" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. The magnitude of the net horizontal force on the small object is <math alttext="F" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. The object is stopped, and then starting from rest, the object is made to spin in a nearly horizontal circle of radius <math alttext="r" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>r</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> so that it is speeding up with acceleration <math alttext="a" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following expressions is correct for the new net horizontal force on the object?
